intro: Pseudolmedia laevis, commonly known as the smooth pseudolmedia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink to purple. Native to tropical regions of South America, it thrives in warm, humid environments with well-drained soil. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms. It prefers full sun to partial shade and is relatively low maintenance once established.
